intro: Jasione capensis, commonly known as the Cape jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has linear to lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Jasione capensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
